alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Northampton County through 645 PM EDT... At 614 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Conway, or 7 miles west of Chowan University, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Northampton County, including the following locations... Milwaukee, Pendleton, Jackson, Galatia, Creeksville and Falsons Old Tavern. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
